llm_answer: Elon Musk moved from South Africa to Canada at age 18 to attend university and acquire citizenship through his Canadian-born mother.
gt_answer: Musk moved to Canada to attend Queen's University and avoid mandatory service in the South African military.

llm_answer: Elon Musk's early interest in computers manifested at the age of 12 when he developed and sold a video game called Blastar.
gt_answer: At the age of 12, Musk sold a simple game called 'Blastar' to a computer magazine for $500.

llm_answer: After moving to Canada, Elon Musk briefly attended the University of Pretoria, then matriculated at Queen's University at Kingston, and later transferred to the University of Pennsylvania where he received bachelor's degrees in economics and physics.
gt_answer: After moving to Canada, Musk spent two years studying at Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario, before transferring to the University of Pennsylvania.

llm_answer: Musk's father, Errol Musk, had a diverse career and was wealthy during Elon's youth, which likely influenced Elon's decision to live with him after his parents' divorce.
gt_answer: Musk and his brother decided to live with their father after the divorce, a decision Musk later regretted due to their troubled relationship.

llm_answer: Elon Musk did not take a university-level aptitude test in computer programming.
gt_answer: Musk scored so high on a university-level aptitude test in computer programming that examiners made him retake the test.

llm_answer: Musk's nightclub venture during his University of Pennsylvania days reflected his entrepreneurial spirit by showcasing his ability to identify business opportunities and take risks in starting new ventures.
gt_answer: Musk and a classmate rented out a 10-bedroom frat house and turned it into a nightclub, showcasing his early entrepreneurial experiments.

llm_answer: Elon Musk left Stanford University's Ph.D. program after just two days to co-found an online city guide software company with his brother.
gt_answer: Musk left Stanford's Ph.D. program after only two days to pursue entrepreneurial opportunities during the dot-com boom.

llm_answer: Musk's first company, Zip2, provided value to newspapers like The New York Times and Chicago Tribune by offering online city guide software that helped them reach a wider audience and enhance their digital presence.
gt_answer: Zip2 provided city travel guides to newspapers, enhancing their digital content offerings.

llm_answer: Elon Musk made $307 million from the sale of Zip2 to Compaq.
gt_answer: The sale of Zip2 to Compaq earned Musk $22 million.

llm_answer: Musk's creation of X.com led to the formation of PayPal through a merger with Confinity in 2000.
gt_answer: X.com, an online banking company founded by Musk, merged with Confinity to form PayPal.

llm_answer: Elon Musk co-founded X.com, which later merged with Confinity to form PayPal. He initially served as CEO of PayPal before it was acquired by eBay in 2002.
gt_answer: Musk was initially named the CEO of PayPal but was later ousted from the position.

llm_answer: Musk's interest in space exploration led to the founding of SpaceX in 2002, with $100 million from the sale of PayPal, to develop spaceflight services.
gt_answer: Musk's interest in reducing space transportation costs and colonizing Mars motivated him to found SpaceX.

llm_answer: SpaceX's Falcon 1 rocket was significant for the company as it was the first privately developed liquid-fueled rocket to reach orbit in 2008.
gt_answer: Falcon 1 was the first privately developed liquid fuel rocket to reach orbit, marking a significant milestone for SpaceX.

llm_answer: SpaceX has contributed to International Space Station (ISS) missions by providing transportation services for crew and cargo to and from the ISS using their Dragon spacecraft.
gt_answer: SpaceX has flown 20 cargo resupply missions to the ISS under a partnership with NASA.

llm_answer: The goal of Musk's Neuralink company is to develop brain-computer interfaces.
gt_answer: Neuralink aims to develop implantable brainâ€“machine interfaces to enhance human capabilities.

llm_answer: Musk's involvement in the electric vehicle industry began with his early investment in Tesla Motors, which later became Tesla, Inc. He became chairman and product architect of Tesla in 2008, eventually assuming the position of CEO.
gt_answer: Musk became involved in the electric vehicle industry by co-founding Tesla, aiming to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy.

llm_answer: Tesla's strategy for entering the electric vehicle market in 2006 was to become an early investor in the electric vehicle manufacturer Tesla Motors, which later became Tesla, Inc. Elon Musk helped create SolarCity, a solar-energy company that was acquired by Tesla in 2016 and became Tesla Energy.
gt_answer: Tesla's strategy was to start with high-price, low-volume vehicles and then move into more mainstream vehicles.

llm_answer: Elon Musk's vision for a high-speed transportation system materialized into the Hyperloop concept when he proposed it in 2013.
gt_answer: Musk's vision for a mega-fast transportation system led to the conceptualization of the Hyperloop, aiming to move people and cargo through tubes at high speeds.

llm_answer: Musk has faced challenges in realizing the Hyperloop project, including criticism, financial constraints, and technical feasibility concerns.
gt_answer: Despite initial hype, the development of a mass-scale Hyperloop system has faced delays and technological challenges.

llm_answer: Musk's approach to AI has evolved with the founding of xAI, showing his continued interest and involvement in the development of artificial intelligence technologies.
gt_answer: Musk founded xAI with the mission to 'understand the true nature of the universe,' reflecting his interest in AI despite previous concerns about its risks.
